definition: "Indem" is a conjunction that is commonly used to express the concept of causality or cause and effect. It is typically employed to introduce a subordinate clause that explains the reason or manner in which an action or event occurs.

examples.german: Indem er hart arbeitet, verdient er viel Geld.
examples.english: By working hard, he earns a lot of money.

examples.german: Sie spart Geld, indem sie weniger ausgibt.
examples.english: She saves money by spending less.

examples.german: Indem er Deutsch lernt, kann er in Deutschland arbeiten.
examples.english: By learning German, he can work in Germany.

examples.german: Indem sie früh aufsteht, hat sie mehr Zeit für sich.
examples.english: By getting up early, she has more time for herself.

examples.german: Er verbessert seine Sprachkenntnisse, indem er Bücher liest.
examples.english: He improves his language skills by reading books.
